ring.definition: a circle of any material, or any group of things or people in a circular shape or arrangement

sing.definition: to make musical sounds with the voice, usually a tune with words

past simple and past participle of

drink.definition: (an amount of) liquid that is taken into the body through the mouth

shrink.definition: to become smaller, or to make something smaller

swim.definition: to move through water by moving the body or parts of the body

begin.definition: to start to happen or exist

run.definition: (of people and some animals) to move along, faster than walking, by taking quick steps in which each foot is lifted before the next foot touches the ground

feed.definition: to give food to a person, group, or animal

past simple and past participle of

past simple and past participle of

past simple and past participle of

past simple and past participle of

hold.definition: to take and keep something in your hand or arms

past simple and past participle of
        
         hold

hit.definition: to move your hand or an object onto the surface of something so that it touches it, usually with force

cut.definition: to break the surface of something, or to divide or make something smaller, using a sharp tool, especially a knife

put.definition: to move something or someone into the stated place, position, or direction

cost.definition: the amount of money needed to buy, do, or make something

hurt.definition: to feel pain in a part of your body, or to injure someone or cause them pain

spread.definition: to cover or reach a wider or increasing area, or to make something do this

draw.definition: to make a picture of something or someone with a pencil or pen

withdraw.definition: to take or move out or back, or to remove

withdrawn.definition: shy and quiet and preferring to be alone rather than with other people

fly.definition: When a bird, insect, or aircraft flies, it moves through the air

flew.definition:
past simple and past participle of
        
         fly

know.definition: to have information in your mind

known.definition: used to refer to something or someone that is familiar to or understood by people

choose.definition: to decide what you want from two or more things or possibilities

freeze.definition: If you freeze something, you lower its temperature below 0°C, causing it to become cold and often hard, and if something freezes, its temperature goes below 0°C

wake.definition: to (cause someone to) become awake and conscious after sleeping

break.definition: to (cause something to) separate suddenly or violently into two or more pieces, or to (cause something to) stop working by being damaged

steal.definition: to take something without the permission or knowledge of the owner and keep it

fall.definition: to suddenly go down onto the ground or towards the ground without intending to or by accident

fallen.definition: lying on the ground, after falling down

write.definition: to make marks that represent letters, words, or numbers on a surface, such as paper or a computer screen, using a pen, pencil, or keyboard, or to use this method to record thoughts, facts, or messages

ride.definition: to sit on something such as a bicycle, motorbike, or horse and travel along on it controlling its movements

drive.definition: to move or travel on land in a motor vehicle, especially as the person controlling the vehicle's movement

driven.definition: Someone who is driven is so determined to achieve something or be successful that all of their behaviour is directed towards this aim

shake.definition: to move backwards and forwards or up and down in quick, short movements, or to make something or someone do this

take.definition: to remove something, especially without permission

overtake.definition: to go past something by being a greater amount or degree

mistake.definition: an action, decision, or judgment that produces an unwanted or unintentional result

mistaken.definition: wrong in what you believe, or based on a belief that is wrong

get.definition: to obtain, buy, or earn something

got.definition:
past simple and past participle of
        
         get

forget.definition: to be unable to remember a fact, something that happened, or how to do something

forgot.definition: to be unable to remember a fact, something that happened, or how to do something

forgotten.definition: to be unable to remember a fact, something that happened, or how to do something

hide.definition: to put something or someone in a place where that thing or person cannot be seen or found, or to put yourself somewhere where you cannot be seen or found

bite.definition: to use your teeth to cut into something or someone

bit.definition: a small piece or amount of something

beat.definition: to defeat or do better than

eat.definition: to put or take food into the mouth, chew it (= crush it with the teeth), and swallow it

swear.definition: to use words that are rude or offensive as a way of emphasizing what you mean or as a way of insulting someone or something

tear.definition: to pull or be pulled apart, or to pull pieces off

wear.definition: to have clothing, jewellery, etc. on your body

give.definition: to offer something to someone, or to provide someone with something

forgive.definition: to stop blaming or being angry with someone for something that person has done, or not punish them for something

forgiven.definition: to stop blaming or being angry with someone for something that person has done, or not punish them for something

forbid.definition: to refuse to allow something, especially officially, or to prevent a particular plan of action by making it impossible

prove.definition: to show a particular result after a period of time

proved.definition: to show a particular result after a period of time

shave.definition: to remove hair from the body, especially a man's face, by cutting it close to the skin with a razor, so that the skin feels smooth

shaved.definition: to remove hair from the body, especially a man's face, by cutting it close to the skin with a razor, so that the skin feels smooth

show.definition: to make it possible for something to be seen

showed.definition: to make it possible for something to be seen

weave.definition: to make cloth by repeatedly crossing a single thread through two sets of long threads on a loom (= special frame)

dive.definition: to jump into water, especially with your head and arms going in first, or to move down under the water

dived.definition: to jump into water, especially with your head and arms going in first, or to move down under the water

dove.definition: a white or grey bird, often used as a symbol of pea

do.definition: used with another verb to form questions and negative sentences, including negative orders, and sometimes in affirmative sentences for reasons of style

go.definition: to travel or move to another place

hear.definition: to receive or become conscious of a sound using your ears

heard.definition: to receive or become conscious of a sound using your ears

have.definition: used with the past participle of other verbs to form the present perfect and past perfect

had.definition:
past simple and past participle of
        
         have  , also used with the past participle of other verbs to form the past perfect

be.definition: used to say something about a person, thing, or state, to show a permanent or temporary quality, state, job, etc.

come.definition: to move or travel towards the speaker or with the speaker

overcome.definition: to defeat or succeed in controlling or dealing with something

see.definition: to be conscious of what is around you by using your eyes

slide.definition: to (cause to) move easily and without interruption over a surface

past simple and past participle of 
        
         slide

lie.definition: to be in or move into a horizontal position on a surface
